oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-04-04 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 4, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Don Gibson (host/performer), guest performer Bill Anderson, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Hank Garland, June Carter, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. On this show, Grant Turner announces TV Radio Mirror Magazine Reader's Poll award to the Opry for America's most popular music show. It is announced that this is the 1017th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: June Carter; Bill Anderson; Del Wood; Don Gibson; Jordanaires
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Don Gibson introduces June Carter -- Comedy routine (June Carter, Don Gibson) -- Prince Albert commercial (June Carter, Don Gibson) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Don Gibson introduces Bill Anderson -- Thrill Of My Life (Bill Anderson) -- Don Gibson introduces Del Wood -- Queenie Of The Town (Del Wood) -- Grant Turner and Don Gibson announce his tour schedule -- A Stranger To Me (Don Gibson, Jordanaires) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Don Gibson) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial -- Network announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States.
